titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Asia and the Pacific, Manila Field Office Files
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, International Division, Asia and the Pacific, Manila Field Office Files FA642

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 15:10:03 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Asia and the Pacific, Manila Field Office Files

physdesc.extent: 27 boxes. 26 record storage boxes and 1 legal size document box.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Appendix A: Reports â€“ Unpublished reports written by Ford Foundation staff and consultants were removed from their original folders, scanned and transferred to the Archives' collection of staff and consultant reports. See Appendix A for a list of these reports and their specific assigned number. The reports are listed in alphabetical order by author. The assigned number may be used to access reports in the online catalog.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Ford Foundation maintained an office in Manila, Philippines from 1962 to 2003. The Manila office was responsible for administering the Foundation's programming for that country. Throughout the course of the Manila office's history, the Foundation's programming for the Philippines focused on projects and initiatives involved with agriculture, water management, forestry, arts, business management and industrial development, population, science education, public administration, language studies, women's rights, sexuality and reproductive health, poverty reduction, and human rights.

The Ford Foundation made its first grants to the Philippines between 1960 and 1961 as part of its activities in South and Southeast Asia. It then established an office in Manila in 1962. Much of the Foundation's early support to the Philippines centered on strengthening the University of the Philippines so that the institution could provide graduate training and research for the country's economic development. By 1967, the Foundation had issued $8,756,000 in grants to the university (South and Southeast Asia information paper, June 1967, Ford Foundation records, Catalogued Reports, Reports 1-3254 (FA739A), Report 002407).

In 1981, the Foundation reduced the Manila office's staff as part of its efforts to reorganize its Southeast Asia Program. The Foundation made its Jakarta, Indonesia office its Southeast Asia Regional Office and transformed its offices in Manila and Bangkok, Thailand into liaison offices under Jakarta (Southeast Asia program review, November 1981,Ford Foundation records, Catalogued Reports, Reports 9287-11774 (FA739D), Report 009597) .

The Foundation unlinked the Manila office from its Jakarta office in 1997, and the Manila office retained its independence until the Foundation closed it in 2003 (The Ford Foundation's Program in the Philippines, 1999, Ford Foundation records, Catalogued Reports, Reports 13949-17726 (FA739F), Report 015013).
